value.title: The Hands-Off Tech Era Is Over
value.excerpt: More government intervention will slow tech down. Is that good or bad? Send any friend a story As a subscriber, you have 10 gift articles to give each month. Anyone can read what you share. By Shira Ovide It’s clear more than ever that governments will no longer leave technology alone.

value.title: Tesla and Honda report over 350 crashes involving advanced driving assistance systems
value.excerpt: Tesla Inc. reported 273 crashes while Honda reported 90 involving advanced driving assistance systems, including Autoplot, since July, according to newly released data.

value.title: AI Ethics Shocking Revelation That Training AI To Be Toxic Or Biased Might Be Beneficial, Including For Those Autonomous Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: One controversial posture by AI Ethics is that we can purposely devise toxic AI or biased AI in order to ferret out and cope with other toxic AI. As they say, sometimes it takes one to know one. This includes self-driving cars too.

value.title: Explained and tested: Tesla’s ‘self-driving’ Autopilot
value.excerpt: Today, Tesla’s rise, both in output and share price, is meteoric. So much so that in March 2022 the Model Y and Model 3 were respectively the best and second best selling cars in the UK. Read any review of a Tesla (including our own) and two big reasons for buying or leasing one will rear their heads.

value.title: AWS with Intel launches DeepRacer Student League
value.excerpt: AWS in collaboration with Intel has announced the launch of the AWS DeepRacer Student League 2022 in India to introduce machine learning (ML) to students in higher education.

value.title: The Artificial Intelligence We Fear Is Our Own
value.excerpt: A Google engineer has been ridiculed for his belief that a language model had become sentient. But the joke is on us if we continue AI research with only profit as the goal.

value.title: What AI developers need to know about artificial intelligence ethics
value.excerpt: Some tools and platforms promise fair and balanced AI, but tools and platforms alone won't deliver ethical AI solutions.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence Helps Identify Benign Thyroid Nodules
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence (AI) pinpoints thyroid nodules noticed on thyroid ultrasound that are unlikely to be cancerous.

value.title: Is Tesla Backtracking On Its Camera-Only Autopilot Strategy?
value.excerpt: A Tesla Model Y was spotted in Canada with a LiDAR system integrated into its roof. Could there be a change coming to Tesla’s camera-only Tesla Vision plan?

value.title: Hyundai pilots driverless car-hailing service in South Korea
value.excerpt: The ride-hailing service will use the auto maker’s IONIQ 5 battery electric vehicles, launched last year, and will be equipped with its in-house developed level 4 autonomous driving technology.

value.title: Tesla secures multi-billion-dollar deal with Samsung for new cameras for self-driving
value.excerpt: Tesla has reportedly secured a multi-billion-dollar deal with Samsung to get new cameras for its self-driving sensor suite. Tesla’s Full Self-Driving (FSD) program relies on cameras to get imagery to feed its neural nets.

value.title: Family sues Meta, blames Instagram for daughter’s eating disorder and self-harm
value.excerpt: A preteen girl’s “addictive” use of Instagram resulted in an eating disorder, self-harm and thoughts of suicide over several years, according to a lawsuit against the platform’s parent company, Meta.

value.title: Uber and Waymo Want to Make Self-Driving Freight Trucks a Thing
value.excerpt: Uber and Waymo have put the past aside, and are now in it for the long haul. On Tuesday, the two companies, previously legal foes, announced a new partnership. Together, they’re planning to combine Waymo’s self-driving technology with Uber Freight’s shipping network to help automate long-distance trucking.

value.title: Uber and Waymo fought in court over self-driving trucks. Now they're teaming up
value.excerpt: Uber and Alphabet's Waymo, which were once embroiled in a lawsuit over self-driving technology, are now working together on fully autonomous trucks.

value.title: Alphabet's Waymo, Uber Freight In Deal For Future Self-driving Trucks
value.excerpt: Waymo Via, the self-driving trucking unit of Alphabet Inc, and Uber Technology Inc's Freight business on Tuesday said they signed a long-term strategic partnership that would allow future customers to deploy autonomous trucks more efficiently.

value.title: Waymo and Uber Partner to Deploy Self-Driving Trucks at Scale
value.excerpt: Waymo and Uber are partnering to make it easier for shippers and carriers to use autonomous trucks. This is another step towards making self-driving semi trucks mainstream and widely available. It's easy to think of self-driving cars as the main battleground for autonomy.

value.title: AI Ethics Alarmed At The Rise In Underhanded Juicing Or Doping Of AI Machine Learning By Trusted Insiders, Including Autonomous Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: Worries are that juicing or doping of AI Machine Learning is gaining traction, an AI Ethical woe and dangerous, including for the case of AI self-driving cars.

value.title: Automated palletizing pays for itself
value.excerpt: Software integration, and increasingly artificial intelligence and machine learning, is playing a bigger role in automated palletization. The massive labor shortage seemingly has no end in sight, especially when it comes to labor-intensive industries.
